com.watr.app.ui.utils

Class PageTracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.watr.app.ui.utils.PageTracker

  • public class PageTracker
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to keep track of what page is currently selected in the view pager.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PageTracker(int initialPage) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean currentPageIsFirst(boolean isBackPress)
      Checks if the current page is the first instance of any page in the application, while checking for a backpress and, if so, notifying that the next setCurrentPage() call needs to be omitted from history (Seeing as setCurrentPage always triggers).
      int getPreviousPage()
      Retrieves the previous page and removes that page from the history.
      void setCurrentPage(int newPage)
      Updates the current page index and stores the now old page index in history.

        Parameters:

      • getPreviousPage

        public int getPreviousPage()
        Retrieves the previous page and removes that page from the history.
        Returns:
        Integer Previous page index

      • currentPageIsFirst

        public boolean currentPageIsFirst(boolean isBackPress)
        Checks if the current page is the first instance of any page in the application, while checking for a backpress and, if so, notifying that the next setCurrentPage() call needs to be omitted from history (Seeing as setCurrentPage always triggers). The latter is utilised to allow the history to actually run out at some point, instead of just flipping between the same two items all the time.
        Parameters:
        isBackPress - Boolean Whether this function was triggered from a backpress, i.e. pressing Back
        Returns:
        Boolean Whether this page is the first instance (Or not)
